intro: Phalangium altissimum, commonly known as the giant spider lily, is a striking plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with prominent yellow stamens. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that are often mistaken for grasses or sedges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Phalangium altissimum is known for its ability to bloom reliably in late spring to early summer.
